sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt) - Purchase from a chemical supplier or online metal supplier; Cu (Copper) - Available at hardware stores or metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - Obtain from a chemical supplier; Tm (Thulium) - Source from specialized metal suppliers or online platforms.
steps: Co (Cobalt) - Purchase from a chemical supplier or online metal supplier; Cu (Copper) - Available at hardware stores or metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - Obtain from a chemical supplier; Tm (Thulium) - Source from specialized metal suppliers or online platforms.

1. Measure out 340 g of Co, 60 g of Cu, 144 g of P, and 56 g of Tm using a digital scale. 2. Place the Co, Cu, and Tm in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Slowly add the Phosphorus while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. 4. Mix thoroughly for 10 minutes using a mechanical mixer or by hand until homogenous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 340 g of Co, 60 g of Cu, 144 g of P, and 56 g of Tm using a digital scale. 2. Place the Co, Cu, and Tm in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Slowly add the Phosphorus while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. 4. Mix thoroughly for 10 minutes using a mechanical mixer or by hand until homogenous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder to a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 950°C (1742°F). 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for proper fusion of the metals.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder to a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 950°C (1742°F). 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for proper fusion of the metals.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over a period of 4 hours to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over a period of 4 hours to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a grinding wheel to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a clear sealant to the surface to prevent oxidation and enhance appearance. 4. Allow sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a grinding wheel to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a clear sealant to the surface to prevent oxidation and enhance appearance. 4. Allow sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
